content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-049-25-A |Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty |Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the purpose of pelvic ultrasound and radiography of the hand and wrist in pathological puberty |Description=None |Rubric=Additional examinations |Contributors= |Order=25}} Pelvic ultrasound in girls to rule out an ovarian tumour/cyst and measure uterine length (if > 35 mm, oestrogen impregnation=early puberty). The purpose of a wrist X-ray is to measure bone age

question.question: What is the purpose of a wrist X-ray in pathological puberty?
question.option_a: To measure uterine length and rule out ovarian tumours/cysts
question.option_b: To assess bone density and mineral content
question.option_c: To measure bone age and detect delayed or precocious puberty
question.option_d: To evaluate the effects of hormonal therapy on bone growth
